column2: so there's this fantastic Wikipedia list 0
descriptively titled Wikipedia : unusual 0
articles I just remembered as that 0
Wikipedia list it's a collection of 0
hundreds of articles about unusual 0
unexpected and unbelievable subjects no 0
matter what link you click it's bound to 0
be interesting for that reason every 0
week I'm going to click on a new link 0
and teach you a little bit more about 0
our amazing world maps are very hard to 0
make to create a map from scratch 1s two 0
years of fieldwork er analyzation of 0
satellite photos so plagiarism has 0
always been rampant among map makers 0
it's pretty easy just to redraw the same 0
geographical features from one map on to 0
a new map and it's hard to get caught 0
you are after all drawing the exact same 0
world so map makers came up with a way 0
to catch individuals stealing their data 0
this is Argyll tynin West Lancashire 0
England according to a 2009 screenshot 0
of Google Maps Argyll tin is a town it's 0
supposedly located between autumn to the 0
south and Ormskirk to the north the 0
problem is if you go to this site this 0
is what you find the Argyll tenue 0
paper towns are fake places that are put 0
on maps as copyright traps a map maker 0
can make up a place and if they see that 0
a competing map maker also has that town 0
on their maps they know that at one 0
point the competitor plagiarized their 0
info so in Argyll Tain's case the town 0
probably wasn't placed there by Google 0
Google gets their data from tella Atlas 0
who sources their data from other 0
mapping companies who in turn get some 0
of their data from other mapping 0
companies somewhere down the line 0
someone must have place Argyll tanaan 0
the map as a trap and its presence on 0
Google Maps was just a remnant of that 0
after the fake town gained widespread 0
media attention who were removed it from 0
their map and it has since been replaced 0
with a marker designating the spot as a 0
ghost town there are hundreds of other 0
examples of Paper Towns in New York a 0
spot north of Roscoe New York was marked 0
as the town of aglow by the general 0
drafting company in 1930 the name came 0
from an anagram of the cartographers 0
initials and appeared on numerous maps 0
since its conception in the 1960s a glow 0
showed up on a Ranma Canali map of the 0
region and thinking they had fallen into 0
their trap 0
Esso who had bought the map from the 0
general drafting company threatened to 0
sue McNally the suit was dropped though 0
when Rand McNally pointing that aglow 0
had actually become a real place 0
sometime in the 1950s locals opened up a 0
general store north of Roscoe New York 0
and after looking at an Esso map of the 0
region decided to call their store the 0
aglow general store there for making a 0
glow an official place the store 0
eventually went out of business and the 0
town is censuses appear for most Maps 0
but this is one instance where a fake 0
town 0
real a similar idea of Paper Towns has 0
been used in other domains in 2001 the 0
word equivalents appeared in the New 0
Oxford American Dictionary defined as 0
the willful avoidance of one's official 0
responsibilities that word was made up 0
as a copyright trap and it actually 0
worked 0
dictionary.com and gules dictionary both 0
added a listing for the word equivalents 0
possibly proving a level of plagiarism 0
among the online dictionaries 0
occasionally unintentional traps are 0
created that prove effective before they 0
created Apple Maps Apple was making maps 0
on a much smaller scale for iPhoto these 0
maps had no attributions and therefore 0
no one could be sure where their data 0
was from but there were some obvious 0
clues this screenshot of Apple's map of 0
Norwich shows an area of disorganized 0
roads in the Northeast if you look at 0
the OpenStreetMap map of the area you 0
can see that these rows are actually 0
trails in a park overlaying the Apple 0
map over the OSM map of the area you can 0
see how perfectly the suppose it road 0
and trails line up you can assume from 0
this that Apple took their map data from 0
Open Street Map and mistook the trails 0
for roads a few months after the release 0
Apple officially credit Open Street Map 0
for their contributions to the maps 0
confirming that they use OSM's data 0
so those are Paper Towns I hope you 0
enjoyed this week's episode I'll be back 0
next week to bring you more from that 0
Wikipedia list 0
